abstract: National Basketball Assn owners could glean lessons from experience of National Hockey League's lost 2004-2005 season, which was canceled due to a labor lockout--a scenario that appears to be playing out with the upcoming NBA season; though the NHL lockout was long and painful, many owners believe it produced a stronger league, with hockey's finances and popularity now booming.
snippet: The National Hockey League was forced to cancel its 2004-5 season, and there are potential lessons in the experience for the National Basketball Association.
lead_paragraph: The National Hockey League was forced to cancel its 2004-5 season, and there are potential lessons in the experience for the National Basketball Association.

headline.main: Season Lost by the N.H.L. Could Teach the N.B.A.
headline.print_headline: Season Lost by the N.H.L. Could Teach the N.B.A.
headline.seo: N.B.A. Could Learn Lessons From N.H.L.’s 2004-5 Impasse
